word_mean: 脑,中枢神经系统位于颅内的部分，包括前脑、中脑和菱脑
脑从胚胎神经管前部衍变(发育)而来。又称encephalon
脑, 奇恒之腑之一，位于颅内，由髓汇聚而成，为神明汇聚之所，有支配精神意识，进行思维活动的功能。

sentence.Network_en: The horrors he experienced are imprinted, perhaps indelibly, in his brain.
sentence.Network_cn: 他经历的恐怖事件在他脑海中刻下了深深的，或许是难以磨灭的印记。

sentence.Network_en: She has a first-class brain and is a damned good writer.
sentence.Network_cn: 她头脑相当灵光，是个非常棒的作家。

sentence.Network_en: Hallucination is common in patients who have suffered damage to the brain.
sentence.Network_cn: 脑部受损的病人常会产生幻觉。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)萦绕于脑际，念念不忘

lj.lj_ly: John has cars on the brain.
lj.lj_ls: 约翰心里老是惦记着汽车。

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Informal} To exert or expend great mental effort
jx.jx_cn_mean: 【非正式用语】 绞尽脑汁，大费脑筋：用光或耗尽极大的智力努力

lj.lj_ly: She beat her brains out during the examination.

jx.jx_cn_mean: 热衷于，念念不忘：一心想着某事

lj.lj_ly: The coach has winning on the brain.
lj.lj_ls: 教练一心想着取得胜利

jx.jx_en_mean: To explore another's ideas through questioning.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 思想剽窃：在解决问题中使用别人的想法
冥思苦想：长时间艰苦地思考

lj.lj_ly: I racked my brain for hours trying to recall her name.
lj.lj_ls: 几小时来我苦苦思索以期回想起她的名字

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  brægen, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch brein

entry.def: Your brain is the organ inside your head that controls your body's activities and enables you to think and to feel things such as heat and pain.

example.ex: Her father died of a brain tumour.

entry.def: Your brain is your mind and the way that you think.

example.ex: Once you stop using your brain you soon go stale...
example.tran: 一旦停止用脑，人很快就会变得迟钝。

example.ex: Stretch your brain with this puzzle.
example.tran: 用这个智力游戏锻炼你的思维能力。

entry.def: If someone has brains or a good brain, they have the ability to learn and understand things quickly, to solve problems, and to make good decisions.

example.ex: They were not the only ones to have brains and ambition...
example.tran: 并不是只有他们聪明、有志向。

example.ex: I had a good brain and the teachers liked me.
example.tran: 我很聪明，老师们都喜欢我。

entry.def: If someone is the brains behind an idea or an organization, he or she had that idea or makes the important decisions about how that organization is managed.

example.ex: Mr White was the brains behind the scheme...
example.tran: 怀特先生是该项计划的幕后策划者。

example.ex: Some investigators regarded her as the brains of the gang.
example.tran: 一些调查员认为她是该团伙的决策者。

entry.def: To brain someone means to hit them forcefully on the head.

example.ex: He had threatened to brain him then and there.
example.tran: 他当时就威胁要打爆他的脑袋。

entry.tran: 把…的脑袋打伤；把…脑袋打开花
entry.def: To beat someone's  brains out or bash their brains in means to hit their head very hard, so that they are badly injured or killed.

example.ex: They stood over him with clubs raised as if to beat his brains out.
example.tran: 他们举着棍子监视着他，好像要揍扁他的脑袋。

entry.tran: （用枪）把…的脑袋打开花；射中…的头部
entry.def: To blow someone's brains out means to shoot them in the head, killing them.

example.ex: Give me all your money or I'll blow your brains out...
example.tran: 把你所有的钱都给我，否则我就一枪把你的脑袋打开花。

example.ex: He blew his brains out with a shotgun.
example.tran: 他用一支猎枪射中了他的脑袋。

entry.def: If someone has something on the brain, they keep thinking about it.

example.ex: You've had chess on the brain since you were little.
example.tran: 你从很小的时候就对下棋产生了浓厚兴趣。

entry.def: If you pick someone's brains, you ask them to help you with a problem because they know more about the subject than you.

example.ex: Why should a successful company allow another firm to pick its brains?
example.tran: 为什么一个成功的企业就得允许别的公司来讨教呢？

means.word_mean: 1. that part of the central nervous system that includes all the higher nervous centers; enclosed within the skull; continuous with the spinal cord

sentences.sentence: "he's got plenty of brains but no common sense"

means.word_mean: 3. that which is responsible for one's thoughts and feelings; the seat of the faculty of reason;

sentences.sentence: "I couldn't get his words out of my head"

means.word_mean: 4. someone who has exceptional intellectual ability and originality;
5. the brain of certain animals used as meat

example.en: What BB brain left the door open?
example.zh: 哪个傻瓜让门敞着不关？

auth_sentence.content: The researchers invited me to have my brain scanned.
auth_sentence.res_content: The researchers invited me to have my brain scanned.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The researchers invited me to have my brain scanned.

auth_sentence.content: Ecstasy acts as a stimulant and increases brain activity.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ecstasy acts as a stimulant and increases brain activity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ecstasy acts as a stimulant and increases brain activity.

auth_sentence.content: His brain, heart and kidneys have been scanned.
auth_sentence.res_content: His brain, heart and kidneys have been scanned.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His brain, heart and kidneys have been scanned.

Sentence.sentence: Behavioral genetics has made important contributions to the biological revolution, providing information about the extent to which biology influences mind, brain and behavior.
For example, social contact can boost development of the brain and immune system, leading to better health and less chance of depression later in life
After a long period, alcoholism can deteriorate the liver, the brain and other parts of the body.
As the brain attempts to force the unsteady hand to do its bidding, the tension between the two results in a more compressed, psychologically denser expression
Our brains respond better to difficulty than we imagine

sentences.en: The human brain is the centre of higher nervous activity.
sentences.cn: 人脑是高级神经活动的中心。

jushi.english: Two brains are better than one.
jushi.chinese: 三个臭皮匠,胜过一个诸葛亮。

jushi.english: John is the brain of the family.
